result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick James Knebel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Patrick James Knebel in court with attorney Joseph H. Loso.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No abusive Contact with  - Ashley S. Knebel
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim " Ashley Knebel   " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
Bail modification hearing:  Defendant appeared in person.  State appeared by Atty Poquette.  Court:  bail amended to no abusive contact with Ashley Knebel.
No contact with Ashley Knebel or her residence.
Defendant appeared in custody via video.  State appeared by Atty Marcoux.  SIBS at $2500.00 no contact with Ashley Knebel or her residence.  Court finds probable cause.
